title: Andy and Helen Get Married
description: With Andy getting married Aunt Bee is looking to move out of the town and live with her sister out of state. Sam suggests she move onto the farm with him and his son Mike. Various members of the community talk to Aunt Bee and convince her how important she is to the town convincing her to re-evaluate her decision.

title: The Harvest Ball
description: The town is a-buzz as plans progress for the annual harvest ball. Betty Swanson becomes the center of attention as Goober and Sam accidentally compete for her attention and the chance to take her to the dance. A strange twist of events at the dance see both Goober and Sam get all they hoped for

title: The Race Horse
description: Sam's cousin, Vince is coming to visit after not seeing him for 5 years. Vince reveals he has a horse that has not lived up to its potential as a race horse and is looking to sell the animal to finance a restaurant he wants to partner in. Sam begins to ask around town in the hope of helping his cousin out, however Aunt Bee cooks up an alternative scheme that may see everyone finish up a winner.

title: Help on the Farm
description: Sam is concerned with the corn crop ready for harvest. Sherriff Andy hears of a scheme to help rehabilitate released prisoners. With some reservation Sam agrees to take on two of the men to help with the harvest. To the men's surprise the town embraces them and seems unconcerned about their former life, until some money seems to go missing

title: The Copy Machine
description: Mike accidentally receives a paper copier through the mail. Rather than returning the machine he and a friend decide to go into business making copies of documents for local business. With a 10 day return policy the kids think they can't lose. That is till they accidentally damage the unit beyond repair and somehow have to explain the situation to Mike's father

title: The Panel Show
description: A television company writes to the town asking them to send two representatives to New York to record a show about where is better Mayberry or New York City. Emmett and Howard are chosen by the town to defend the honor of all small towns across America. Things don't go well and Howard returns to Mayberry an outcast till an odd twist of events teaches the town and Howard some inner truths.

title: Youth Takes Over
description: Sam pushes for a new youth initiative that will allow students to take up the major role in running the town for a day. The children embrace their roles with far more enthusiasm than anyone thought.

title: The Church Play
description: The town council is concerned with the drop in fund raising efforts for the Church. They discover the problem is with the annual charity play. They ask the producer to stand down but a then faced with who will replace her.

title: Mike's Losing Streak
description: Mike is excited to be going to a big league baseball game. Sam has put conditions on him being allowed, but it remains to be seen if he can live up to the challenge.

title: Sam Gets a Ticket
description: Sam runs into trouble with the police after he makes a turn without signaling. Sam doesn't think he's done anything wrong, but is unsure if he should contest the ticket in court.

title: Emmett's 50th Birthday
description: Emmett is about to turn 50. The town and his family are keen to organize a party. However Emmett becomes increasingly negative about both his up coming birthday and party.

title: Miss Farmerette
description: At the state fair, Millie is crowned Miss Farmerette to the great joy of Mayberry. In winning the contest, she attracts the attention of an ex-Hollywood talent agent wanting to get back to the top.

title: Sam and the Teenager
description: Sam is interviewed by a student taking a journalism course at school. She quickly becomes infatuated with him and struggles to control her crush.

title: New Couple in Town
description: The town is a buzz when news spreads that a new couple have moved into the area. The town is further intrigued when they discover one of the couple is a writer. But as is always in Mayberry, nothing is ever what it seems.

title: Aunt Bee's Cruise: Part 1
description: After a conversation with Mike, Aunt Bee realizes it is time for the ship cruise she's always wanted. The town get wrapped up in her preparations and see it as a chance for her to land a man.

title: Aunt Bee's Cruise: Part 2
description: Aunt Bee arrives home from her cruise with the exciting new she is engaged to be married to the captain of the ship she was on. Some of the townsfolk express concerns about the captains real motivation.

title: Driver Education
description: The local school decides to institute a new driver education program. Everyone in the town council is very supportive, however the question of who will teach the students creates some interesting problems.

title: Howard's Hobby
description: Howard's developing relationship with Grace leads him to want to explore her hobbies and interests. Unfortunately her choice of interests may challenge Howard on every level.

title: The Camper
description: Sam and the other adults in the town decide to invite their children on a camping trip to show them the value of friendship after a number of the children have a falling out.

title: Sam, the Expert Farmer
description: Sam is concerned his string bean crop has turned out very poorly. He becomes more concerned when Millie grows the same vegetable with far better results.

title: The Pet Shop
description: A new pet shop opens in Mayberry and Mike is all fired up to purchase a new Dog. Sam vetoes the idea based on previous previous experience with pets. Mike sets out to prove him wrong.

title: An Efficient Service Station
description: A representative from the acme petroleum company visits Goober's gas station. He is very unimpressed with Goober's efforts and wants changes or Goober may be out of a job.

title: Emmett's Retirement
description: The town is in an uproar when Emmett announces he is retiring, leaving the town with no repair facilities.

title: Millie's Girlfriend
description: Millie has a girlfriend, Renee, visiting from New York who has recently broken up with a long time partner. Millie asks Sam to show her around and keep her busy. Unfortunately Renee interprets Sam's kindness the wrong way and begins to find herself attracted to him.

title: The Church Bell
description: Mayberry gets word a nearby town has a church bell for sale. The Mayberry committee go and make an offer, but a battle of wills breaks out over the price.

title: Sister Cities
description: Mayberry gets an invitation to join a sister city program by the United States government. The citizens of Mayberry embrace the idea and arrange for a delegation from their Mexican sister city, Porto Bello to visit Mayberry.

title: Andy's Baby
description: Andy and Helen return to Mayberry for a visit and bring their new baby, Andy Jr. with them. They want to christen their child in Mayberry and want to have Sam act as Godfather. This hurts the feelings of Howard, Goober, and Emmett whom all feel they are more qualified. A somewhat unorthodox compromise is arranged.

title: Howard, the Poet
description: Howard is commissioned to write a poem for a literary magazine. He is very proud and excited at the prospect of being published. Writer's block spoils his happiness and frustration soon takes over.

title: Millie, the Model
description: Milie is given the opportunity to travel to New York City and be a model. She is excited and accepts the offer. Sam is happy for her but it isn't long before he starts to have misgivings and he's off to NYC himself.

title: Mike's Birthday Party
description: Mike is planning on having a birthday party with no girls invited. His party falls on the same day as Sally's party...but she is inviting boys. The boys are all set to go to Mike's until Sally starts bribing them with great prizes.

title: The Farmer Exchange Project
description: Sam Jones has been chosen by the U.S. Department of Agriculture to participate in a Farmer Exchange Project with the U.S.S.R. The Russians are sending a professor to Mayberry to learn about American farming practices. When Sam travels to Mount Pilot to pick up the Prof. he is surprised to find a woman. She is very proper and reserved and Millie thinks she would have a good time at the dance on Saturday. Sam enlists Howard to escort her and try to bring her out of her shell.

title: Millie and the Palm Springs Golf Pro
description: Still vacationing in Palm Springs Sam bumps into an old war buddy named Charlie Harris. Charlie if a golf pro at one of the clubs and agrees to give Millie a few lessons. Charlie's a bit of a flirt and makes a pass at Millie. When she tells Sam he just laughs it off and Millie becomes furious. She believes she is being taken for granted and comes up with a plot to make Sam jealous.

title: Goober's Brother
description: Goober's brother is returning to Mayberry to visit him. He hopes his brother will be impressed with his accomplishments but those hopes are soon dashed when he discovers his brother is an important engineer for the space program.

title: Millie, the Secretary
description: Millie is enrolled in the Bradbury Business College to hone her secretarial skills and get a better job. She passes and discovers through several interviews that getting a job is going to be harder than she thought. She finally lands a job with two men in the magazine subscription business. Little does she realize however that she is actually working for two bookies and the magazine subscription business is a front for their illegal gambling.
